item.title: Pride in progress on the Liner Gaff
item.description:
I am proud of all I have done.

  • I explored and experimented
  • I faced my shame regarding tucking
  • I kept working at it even when I was disheartened
  • I pushed myself to share it with people, regardless of how scary that was
  • I created a website to show people
  • I am proud of how well this functions
  • and how painless it is compared to its competitors

I so easily fall into shame and fear when I want to tell people about my gaff. It's not perfect. The elastic is too thick right now. The hooks still often create tiny bumps because I haven't quite figured out the perfect placement. The back of the panel still bunches up and can sometimes pinch. I haven't found a way to resolve that yet.

But what I have done is remarkable, note worthy and worth sharing. One day I'll stop having to fight myself at all and purely believe it.

Thank you for letting me share what I have to be proud of.
item.dc:creator: Luna Umbra

item.title: Introducing: The Liner Gaff
item.description:
The Liner Gaff is a personal project I have been working on for a few years now to create a gaff that fits the needs of those who tuck daily/regularly.

After trying nearly every kind of commercial option and do it yourself option, I was disenchanted. These options were expensive, cheap, bulky, ugly, or painful. So I began experimenting.

I came up with a list of lofty features and kept aiming for them. As of today, I feel I have met these features more so than nearly all other gaff options out there. I hope by sharing this with the world it can get even closer to meeting those goals.

I struggle a lot with the balance of authenticity and veneer. I truly believe in the progress I have made with this gaff design and the improvements yet to come. However this ethical quandary of authenticity versus propaganda keeps my stomach churning. Do I sell? or undersell? How do I create realness?

After all this time, energy, and experimenting. As I grow out of shame, fear, and pain, I am ready to share my project with the world. I am so proud of this.

What to Expect

I am very happy to have this website up, and cannot wait to keep updating everyone with the progress I am making.

I want as much feedback as I can get so I can make something that valuable for all my siblings.

You'll also see:

  • Posts about theory and goals
  • Updates about materials/design
  • Compelling feedback from people
  • Milestones
  • In person visits with people who try it

I am preparing to head south for a couple months very soon. I will be on the road, and hopefully meeting up with as many people as possible, making gaffs.
item.dc:creator: Luna Umbra
